alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 08 at 9:03PM PDT until June 12 at 6:21AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday and continues through the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall to the Cascades. In addition, rivers fed by melting snow, from the Cascades and mountains of British Columbia, will be running high this week. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued no later than Thursday afternoon at 215 PM PDT.
